title: Return Value Mastery
subtitle: Functions That Give Back
description:
# Return Values: Getting Results Back

## Why Return Values Matter

Return values let you USE the result of a function:

```gdscript
# Without return - can't use the result
func calculate_damage_bad(strength: int) -> void:
    var damage = strength * 2
    print(damage)  # Just shows it

# With return - can use it anywhere!
func calculate_damage_good(strength: int) -> int:
    var damage = strength * 2
    return damage

var total = calculate_damage_good(15)  # total = 30
var doubled = total * 2  # Can use it!
```

## Multiple Return Statements

```gdscript
func check_health(hp: int) -> String:
    if hp > 80:
        return "Healthy"
    elif hp > 50:
        return "Injured"
    else:
        return "Critical"
```

## Returning Complex Data

```gdscript
func create_weapon() -> Dictionary:
    return {
        "name": "Sword",
        "damage": 25,
        "rarity": "rare"
    }
```

## Your Quest

Create functions that return useful values.
starterCode:

    pass

# 3. Create item dictionary

    pass

# Test functions
hints: Use returned values in other code
